div1.p: Lazear regrets to hear that Johnson is dead. Mabel Lazear is delighted with her present.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 26, 1898

opener.dateline:
CLINICAL LABORATORY,
THE JOHNS HOPKINS HOSPITAL,
BALTIMORE,
July 26. 98.

div1.p:
Your letter
reached me this morning.

I am very sorry to hear
of the death of Mr. Johnson.
Please tell Jane that she
has my sympathy.

I shall not write
to her.

The Bowman family have
certainly had many
losses lately.

It has been warm
here but not uncomfortable.
Mabel is delighted with
the present you sent her.

The will probably go
North a week from
Friday. I shall probably
stay at Miss Freemans
for a part of the time
at least.

Give my kind regards
to Miss Annie Bowman
and Jane.
